meanings.definition: To be excessively concerned with minor details or faults.
meanings.sent1: She tends to nitpick every little mistake in my work.
meanings.sent2: Please don't nitpick over the color of the font, just submit the report.
meanings.sent3: The teacher couldn't help but nitpick at the crooked line I drew on the board.
meanings.sent4: His constant nitpicking was like a magnifying glass on my errors.
meanings.sent5: Her nitpicking made the whole project feel overwhelming.

meanings.definition: A person who habitually finds fault with minor details.
meanings.sent1: My sister is such a nitpick when it comes to cleanliness.
meanings.sent2: The boss is known as the office nitpick for always pointing out small mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The nitpick in our group always makes us double-check everything.
meanings.sent4: He was a nitpick, always searching for flaws in our plans.
meanings.sent5: The nitpick's sharp eye caught the smallest errors.
